data.title: Bitwise Solana's ETF-backed trading volume exceeded $72 million on its second day, surpassing expectations.
data.description: Bitwise's Solana-Staking ETF (ticker symbol BSOL) saw a record-breaking $72.4 million in trading volume on its first day, following a $56 million initial listing, making it the best-performing ETF among nearly 850 new ETFs launched this year. Bloomberg senior ETF analyst Eric Balchunas called this an "amazing number," indicating market enthusiasm exceeding expectations. BSOL saw approximately $69.5 million in inflows on its first day, bringing its total assets to nearly $292 million. Meanwhile, Canary's Litecoin ETF (LTCC) and HBAR ETF (HBR) saw trading volumes of approximately $8 million and $1 million respectively on their second day, while Grayscale's Solana-Staking ETF (GSOL) saw approximately $4 million. Currently, over 150 ETP applications tracking 35 crypto assets are awaiting SEC approval in the US market, with Solana and Bitcoin-related products being the most numerous.

data.title: Securitize partners with BNY to launch tokenized credit fund on Ethereum
data.description: Securitize has launched the “Tokenized AAA CLO Fund” (STAC), providing investors with on-chain exposure to AAA-rated mortgage-backed obligations (CLOs) via Ethereum. BNY provides custody and fund services, and Grove, the on-chain capital allocation arm of the DeFi protocol Sky, plans to invest $100 million as a cornerstone investment. The fund aims to improve the accessibility and settlement efficiency of CLO investments while driving the development of the real-world asset (RWA) tokenization market. Securitize also plans to go public soon through a merger with Cantor Fitzgerald SPAC.

data.title: Meta's revenue hit a record high, but profits were significantly reduced due to a one-off tax expense.
data.description: Meta Platforms (META.O) reported record third-quarter revenue on Wednesday, but the company warned of continued increases in future capital expenditures, causing its shares to fall by about 8% in after-hours trading. The company said third-quarter revenue was $51.2 billion, a 26% year-over-year increase; net income was $2.7 billion, far below analysts' expectations. The company attributed the significant drop in net income to a one-time tax expense of $15.93 billion recognized in support of Trump's "Big Beauty Act." Meta expects fourth-quarter revenue to be between $56 billion and $59 billion, roughly in line with market expectations. The company also stated that it expects total expenditure growth in 2026 to be significantly higher than in 2025, primarily due to rising infrastructure costs, including increased cloud computing spending and higher depreciation expenses. Meta also raised its 2025 capital expenditure forecast to between $70 billion and $72 billion, up from its previous estimate of $66 billion to $72 billion.

data.title: The Hong Kong Monetary Authority cut interest rates by 25 basis points.
data.description: The Hong Kong Monetary Authority (HKMA) cut its base rate by 25 basis points to 4.25%, following the Federal Reserve's 25 basis point rate cut overnight. (Jinshi)

data.title: Mastercard plans to acquire crypto infrastructure startup Zerohash for up to $2 billion.
data.description: Mastercard is planning to acquire Chicago-based crypto and stablecoin infrastructure startup Zerohash for up to $2 billion. This acquisition would further expand Mastercard's crypto business into the stablecoin and tokenization infrastructure sector.

data.title: Consensys plans to go public in the US, and has hired JPMorgan Chase and Goldman Sachs as lead underwriters.
data.description: Consensys, the developer of the MetaMask wallet and an Ethereum infrastructure company, plans to go public in the United States and has hired JPMorgan Chase and Goldman Sachs as lead underwriters for the IPO.

data.title: Has Mastercard accepted the inevitability of crypto? Spends $2B on tokenization platform
data.description:
Mastercard may soon make a significant investment to fully enter the crypto space. According to Reuters, the company is in advanced talks to acquire Zero Hash for roughly $1. 5 to $2 billion, a move that, if completed, would fold a regulated crypto-settlement network into one of the world’s largest payment processors
source: https://cryptoslate.com/has-mastercard-accepted-the-inevitability-of-crypto-spends-2b-on-tokenization-platform/
